ratings.comment: She can be a little unconventional at times and not play by the books (which is funny because the class I took with her is about literature.) Nevertheless, at least for her Gen Ed class, just be respectful and put in effort, and take pride in your work, and you should be able to succeed!

Not sure how people have such negative reviews, I had a completely different experience. She is one of the kindest teachers I have had and has gone out of her way to help me. The lectures are boring but if you just show up you get all the points. Same with the exams, she tells you what to do, and if you just follow directions you will do well.

The worst professor I have ever gotten. I went to ask why her TA had marked me down on my paper and she made up random criteria that was not in the assignment to justify it and when I probed further, was extremely rude and demeaning. Assignments are very unclear and she makes no effort to explain them.

she's an engaging professor, but she's particularly harsh on students and uses the 'old age' card to get away with it. Even walking up to her and asking her a doubt/correction error or literally anything was a scary experience because her responses were kinda passive aggressive and standoffish. Overall an interesting professor,though.

Her TA gave me a terrible grade on a final paper that I worked extremely hard on. When I confronted Susan to ask about it, she told me she hadn't seen my paper. After reading it she said she would have given it an even lower grade. Then proceeded to belittle and bully me over a string of about eight emails. Reported her to department.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Instructions for essays and discussion posts are vague, but you'll get docked if you miss one thing. Attendance is mandatory but lectures are terrible and add nothing to the course. She clearly wasn't familiar with material, but didn't make any attempts to change that.

While this class was incredibly easy, Professor Dominguez displayed incredibly unprofessional behavior throughout the semester. She is rude to students, her assignments are unclear, and her lectures are irrelevant. Luckily most assignments/papers are based on readings which is why many students get by. Her lectures online would have you screwed.

On first day, when the only POC walked in, she yelled at him for being 15 seconds late and no one else who was late. She won't assign 1000+ word papers until a few days before they're due, and they're only 4 points with small grammar mistakes being -0.25 EACH. Talks a lot about when we "get to the real world." Made me come to class w/ a concussion.

Took the class just to satisfy breadth, and it was perfect. She understood that many ppl were doing this, and assigned the workload accordingly. Only a few papers, could get away without reading, and although some the the grading was questionable, most people got an A in her class. Excellent class to take for reqs, and interesting topics covered.

Somewhat difficult class. Assignments (even whole essays) are all worth about 3-4 points and little mistakes like incorrect word order of a citation will cost you about .5 points. Go to office hours. If you're thinking about taking a class from this professor, do not let the other ratings completely steer you away, but be prepared to put in work.

She's a nice teacher and is accommodating if you need extensions or extra resources, but her directions for assignments are very unclear and if assignments are not done to her standard, she doesn't explain why or how to improve. Also, she grades assignments out of 4 points so if you make one mistake you're down to 3.75/4 right away.

Took class online spring 2021. Dominguez was awful. Spouted COVID-19 conspiracy theories in the third week of class, rambled on and on about nothing comprehensible, made us buy a textbook and then didn't use material from it, played favorites, was just generally terrible. Avoid her at all costs unless you can get on her good side right away.

If I am honest I feel like the class was very unorganized, this was because about a week or two in the restarted the entire class as she forgot to inform us a lot. The end of the year pulled in very quickly and she forgot about the end of the year paper but still required it from us though she was very lenient on it as well.
The worst professor I had in my four years at UW. Very condescending and inconsiderate, and to be quite frank, flat out rude to students.
On the first day of class, she gave a land acknowledgment and then said that we should "get over it." This is completely unacceptable for an instructor in this department.

This professor was beyond disorganized. She would ramble on end for the entire lecture time about unrelated topics like 9/11 and the Vietnam war (she never made an attempt to relate this to any native nations). She also was extremely hostile to students who would ask questions or attempt to provide accurate data on reservation life or covid stats.

She mentioned her unvaccinated daughter multiple times. She excused not being vaccinated. Many bias reports filed against her. The textbook also becomes your professor! Felt like I was in an 80's college movie, she would write a single word on the board and talk for an hour and those were our "notes."
Easily the worst teacher Ive ever had at UW. Her lectures were miserable and the material was beyond boring.

There were never clear instructions or grading criteria. For example, the instructions for our midterm were in multiple different places, hidden in canvas. There were never rubrics at all. This professor also is unhelpful when confronted with questions, and gets very hostile. Not sure why UW hired her...
